intro: Arundarbor griffithiana, commonly known as the Himalayan orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant blooms that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a single, showy flower per stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
